lines.text: Give me a name!
Weren't your parents supposed to do that?
[Mr. Jigsaw is holding a gun to Sgt. Colt's head]
Who are you?
I am your worst nightmare.
No, waking up without my penis is my worst nightmare.
Okay, allright, so I'm not your worst nightmare. But I'm right up there!
Half the payment now. Half tomorrow. Half on delivery.
That her?
No, that's a picture.
Do you sleep in the nude?
Only when I'm naked
So what are you doing here?
Waiting for you.
I mean, what brought you here?
A taxi.
Yeah, but why?
My car's in the shop.

[Colt holds up a cue card to Destiny, reading]
"I mean... Why the hell did you come here?"
The police station would have made me nervous.
You better go.
Coffee, Ted?
Ted's from a dysfunctional family.
Oh, so, no coffee.
There's something between you and this General Mortars.
He was my CO in 'Nam. CIA listed him as MIA, but the VA ID'd his MO and we put out an APB.
Oh, I see.
Quid pro quo Mr Colt.
What does that mean?
It means I'm pretentious.
Where's the microfilm, Mike?
I don't know, I gave it to York. I thought she was one of your men.
Act in haste, repent in leisure.
But he who hesitates is lost.
Never judge a book by its cover.
What you see is what you get.
Loose lips, sink ships...
Life is very short, and there's no time for fussing or fighting, my friend.
[Gen. Morters, cornered, looks to Mr. Jigsaw]
[Mr. Jigsaw consults Bartlett's Familiar Quotations, shakes his head]
Sorry Mike, no good.

[after shooting up a trailer home which then blows up, a man then rises from the flaming wreckage waving a make-shift white flag]
What the hell are you doin?
Uh. Is this 1014 Pacific coast Highway?
HUH?
1014 Pacific coast Highway?
NO! THIS IS 814 PACIFIC COAST HIGHWAY! 1014 IS TWO BLOCKS UP THAT WAY!
[Points to his right]
Sorry! My mistake!

[sarcastically]
YEAH! NO PROBLEM! NO PROBLEM!

Nice weather? You think we're having... nice weather? I guess you didn't lose the only one that meant anything in your life. I guess you don't feel burned out by the human misery and despair perpetrated by the criminal vermin that infest every pore of this decaying city, forcing you to guzzle cheap wine and cheaper whiskey to dull the pain that shatters your heart, rips at your soul, and keeps your days forever gray. What flavor Icee you got today?

Don't be so fast to thank me on this, Luger, because you're going to be naked on this one. It's on the line for you. People are going to be watching. Now you blow it, you're going down. You screw up, you're going to be hung out to dry. You drop the ball, you're going to be left twisting in the wind. If you embarrass this department, your pants will be dancing with figs. Is that clear?
Everything but the pants fig thing.
You got anything smaller?
Keep it.
Anything larger?
I don't think York was a suicide. She was on to something.
On something is more likely. You know as well as I that this guy's cookies were laced with cocaine.
No wonder I couldn't eat just one.
[Colt and Luger's car blows up]
Good thing we used valet parking.
Taxi!
[the taxi blows up]
It's gonna take a lot more than a couple of car bombs to get us off of this case.
Not a helluva lot more.
What? I don't know nothin'. I didn't see nothin'. I ain't say nothin'.
Nothing, the word is nothing, not nothin'. There's an i-n-g on the end of it. Nothing.
Ok, nothing. Nothiiing. Nothiiiiiiiiiiing. Ok, you happy?
That's better.
I just gotta ask... what does human flesh taste like?
Chicken.

[holding a gun on York]
In a little while, Miss York, you will be begging for mercy.
No, no, I'll beg now.
What's going on in here?
Drop your gun Mr. Luger!
I don't have one...

[confused]
You are not carrying a weapon?
Don't believe in them.

[slides a gun over]
Pick up the gun.
[picks up the gun]
*Drop* the gun Mr. Luger!
My wife and I haven't had sex in over two years. I have a six month old daughter.
You have reached the desk of sergeant Wes Luger, please leave a message after the beep.
Yeah Wes it's...
Hey I said after the beep!
Well excuse me!
I'm getting too old for this bike-confiscating shit!
Bust at a cookie factory? I don't know. Can you trust her
[Destiny]
Yeah.
How do you know? You kissed her?
Well, sort of.
French?
[Colt shakes head]
Give her a hickey?
[Colt shakes head]
Shaved her back?
[Colt shakes head]
Handled her hooters?
[Colt shakes head]
You parked the pink Cadillac?
[Colt shakes head]
Well what could you possibly know about her?
I know we both wear the same size Pumps.
Are you one of those macho guys who just hates women, Colt?
If I tell you something, do you promise it'll just stay between us?
Your secret's safe with me, Colt. Whatever you tell me doesn't leave this car. You have my word.
[both are unaware the cop radio is active]
All right.
[cut to police headquarters, where Colt is heard over the police radio]
My mother never breast-fed me. She'd... tease me with it, then give me the bottle. It went on for years.
[cut to an airport, where Colt is heard over the loudspeaker]
By the time I hit thirteen, I developed a love-hate thing with breasts, and a distrust of all women.

[cut to Earth orbit, where Luger is heard by a space crew]
Hell, I breast-fed 'til I was sixteen, and I still don't understand women.
[space crew laughs]
Cappuccino? Espresso?
[tries to dispense some, but the coffee machine flies sparks]
Hey Scotty, can you get this machine to work?
I'm givin' it all she's got, Captain! If I push it any farther, the whole thing'll blow!
So what're we looking at here, Doc?
The worst-dressed stiff I've ever seen.
This "stiff" and I pounded a beat together for five years. So show some respect, Doc.
I'm sorry, Wes. You know, I see so much of this senseless mayhem that sometimes I get a little insensitive.
[nods with understanding]
All right. This loser has taken the chicken-shit way out and punched her own ticket.
Suicide, huh?
[He turns over York's body; there is an expression of surprise frozen on her face]
She must have caught herself by surprise.

[after being shot]
La Commedia è Finita!
Claire and I rode together for seven years.

York and I were in academy together. Then we partnered for five years. Before that, we dodged the draft together. Before that, we played high school football together. Before that, we were in grade school together. And before that, we breast fed together.
We're investigating a felony, Miss Demeanor.

[after being questioned about the microfilm]
McCracken!
Thank you, Ms York!
[shoots York]

[turns around, confused]
Is that Dan McCracken, or Mike McCracken?
Mike...
[Mr. Jigsaw shoots York again]

[turns around again]
Is he on Alpine or Oak?

[thinking]
Alpine...
[shoots York again]
Psst... Park on Third- you'll never find a spot on Alpine.

[smiling]
Thank you! You have been most co-operative!

[in pain]
Don't mention it.
[shoots York again]
I would love to eat his cookies with some fava beans and a nice chilled Fresca.
[licks lips]
[Jack Colt mixes a drink with Jack Daniel's Old No. 7, Bushmills Irish Whiskey, Stolichnaya Vodka and tops it off with chocolate flavored syrup]
Here's to getting through another lousy day...
[Jack drinks the whole glass]
Ow.
What?
Painful cuticle.
You think that's painful?
[touches face]
Razor burn.

[holding stomach]
Retaining water.

[lifts shirt, revealing metal piece in flesh]
Nickle beer night, Dodger stadium.

[points to scars]
And these? Vietnam?

[shakes head]
Parochial school. Grenade...
[rips left arm off]
riot at a Love Connection taping.
That's nothing.
[pulls her hair forward, revealing a metal plate]
Elective surgery. I was a fool.
[opens chest, revealing hamster riding a wheel]
Low budget organ transplant.
Oh Colt... enough foreplay. We were made for each other.
York was a friend of mine. She was onto something. I think that's what got her killed.
You don't think it was the bullets?
